text: why do blood groups matter blood gives
us life and there are about five liters
of it pumping around our body each year
millions of people donate a small amount
to save the lives of others but you
can't just give your blood to anyone
back in 1900 a scientist discovered that
blood could be divided into groups
they're called a being a B and O people
in the same group can safely give blood
to each other but mix certain groups
together and the patient could die blood
groups differ because the red blood
cells have different kinds of molecules
on their surface Group A has one kind
group B has another a B has both types
and group O has none if you're given the
wrong blood with the wrong molecules
your immune system sees it as an
intruder and goes on the attack people
with blood group O are known as
universal donors as their blood can be
given to anyone research shows that Type
O blood is also more resistant to severe
malaria different blood groups are more
common in certain parts of the world but
wherever you live though with someone in
need of the perfect match one day it
could even be you
